author: A_Brickset_user
title: Here comes Ogel!
review:
This was my first Alpha Team set, and it has the perfect bad guy! I like this first Ogel, before he got that silly hook. The ship is neat, but I doesn't look it can fly...
This set is great even though it's so small.

author: smiley905
title: pretty godd for a small set
review: this is a good set, and comes with lots of good peices. i like ogle he looks realy cool, and the airboats not that bad, i like the proppeler on the back. i like pretty much all if the set, but the guns are a bit to big. theres not that much to the set so theres not much to say.

author: EL_Mo
title: Pure genius.
review:
Congrats Lego for a job well done. I personally think that the alpha team was the best theme ever, and this set was a great addition. Comes with the best villain ever: Ogel. The design is great and is cool how you can turn it into a little mech. I would recommend this to anybody.
 Also: Has anyone else noticed that Ogel is Lego spelled backwards? Wacky, huh?

author: Tri_pod_king
title: Ogel-tastic!
review:
I just loved this set. It's a cute little set, and you get a lot of nice and reusable lego pieces. And it includes Ogel. OGEL! And it's like a land, sea, or air vehicle! I bought this set 3 times, dude! And it's sturdy. The only con about this set is that since it's so small, I've said basically everything there is to say. But who knows? Maybe Singing cow will have more to say about this set.

                                             -Tri-pod king

author: vincent_vda
title: Ogel rules
review:
I bought this set for one reason: to get a rather cheap Ogel minifig. The vehicle has a few usable parts but isn't that great.

I used the Ogel head as a villain many times, be it in Space or with the Castle set.

author: gmod1001
title: Small, Low Price, Cool Pieces, and best of all OGEL!
review:
Well as the summary above says, this set it great!

Its a rather small, but low price set! Although not rare, its got some cool pieces, like the Guns and Fan Blade, but the best thing that comes with it is Ogel.
He is the ultimate (Typical) bad guy! He has great pieces, great style, and fits in almost any theme, be is Alpha Team, Castle or Pirates.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Alpha Team - Ogel Command Striker
review:
The Ogel Command Striker (6771) is a LEGO Alpha Team set which came out in 2001. It comes with 1 minifig and 29 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces. The instruction also comes with a comic.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/6771-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Ogel: Ogel comes with a black suit, a black armor and a black helmet with a shiny golden visor. On his face you can see a red eye which I think is supposed to be blood.

Ogel Command Striker:

The Ogel command striker is very easy to build. There're two lasers on each side and on the front you can see two joysticks. On the back is a propeller which spins full 360Â°. There're also two flames on each blade which you can sviwel. It's a cool model to have.


Ideas:

This set also comes with 3 ideas which you can build with the pieces of this set. There're no instructions for those models but you can build them from the pictures on my website.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifig
Nice starter set
No stickers
Ideas which you can find at the and of the instructions and/or the box

Negative:

Not so many play features

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Stopmotion 3
Stopmotion 4
Stopmotion 5
Review

author: Legonat
title: The only small set with Ogel
review:

author: NickBrick
title: One of my very first Lego sets!
review:
Like I said above this was one of my first sets.Alpha team was My favorite theme back when I was 3 now I am 12 and I still think it rocks.I recently rebuilt my entire Lego collection[Over 50 sets] and this is still a great set.the rare trans-red gives makes this set unique to my collection.Ogel is a bit plain[no printing on anything]but still he is cool.Fans of Lego Castle will reconize his face as the face of the Malloc the malighn from the Lego movie.Its agreat set for the insane price of 4$ Well...It used to be 4 bucks anyway.there no cons to this set.

                                      Pros.

                             pieces

                              Ogle

                            size for price.

author: clundsberg
title: Just realized Ogel is Lego spelled backwards...
review:
I mean I certainly don't recall realizing that when I bought it in early 2000's.  See what 10 years gone by and thinking of a clever title does at 12:28 am?

Anyhoo - I perhaps overrated this set compared to some other reviews, but I am thinking of it from a different angle by how it fits in with the other anti-Alpha Team set.

The only minor issue that I found was that the design and build were faily basic.  The pluses outweigh this though:

-You get the main baddy, Ogel! (Lego backwards....huh)

-Ogel has a cool gold-plated visor a la Cobra Commander that covers up his James Bond villain-ish mug. Helmet attachment is original as well.

-Alpha Team series was big on those cool flames coming out of the exhaust - great effect.

-Good colour scheme and nifty transparent pieces to boot!

-This vehicle fits nicely into the riverway slot on the command center. DING DING DING!

Overall I enjoyed the Alpha Team series.  I think I had all of the first wave minus maybe one set.  I loved that they were individualized by names and the vehicles were well thought-out, original, and that the overall concept of these two organizations foiling eachother at every turn makes me hope that they bring the series back soon. They were all great builds.

Price on this is fantastic for what you got.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Ogel is Cheap
review:
Set #6771 Ogel Command Striker: The Alpha Team's hated enemy has his own private vehicle. Well, I'm not sure if he's hated, perhaps strongly disliked would be more friendly a term.

 

The Ogel Command Striker is a small cheap model featuring one lone Mini-Figure, the Evil Lord Ogel, in his original two handed version. The vehicle is built using standard and perhaps not-so-standard pieces in a mixture of red, black, gray and transparent orange. It is a small vehicle and unfortunately some of the pieces are quick to detach during play sessions.

 

This set was good in that it allowed you to get Ogel cheaply, but a little on the dissapointing side because it used so few pieces, and some of the parts enjoyed detaching from the main model while playing with it. And yes, I know I'm repeating myself, but these facts deserve repeating.

 

Overall I'd still recommend this set for collectors who want to have Lord Ogel without the hook hand at a discount price. Had I thought more about it before ridding myself of this set I might have held off and perhaps offered it up for sale, as it stands it is gone now, hopefully being enjoyed by a child in this big wide world. but at 4$ US... According to this site, you really can't go wrong with it. (I believe it cost 7$ CND.)

author: JoystickJunkie
title: Ogel should talk to his minions, get himself a new Command Striker
review:
At the turn of the millennium, Lego had lots of sets that I lusted over in the catalogues as a kid with no money – Adventurers, Rock Raiders, Star Wars, Harry Potter, Alpha Team.  Hell, I even wanted the Belville sets if only for the baseplates.  I never got the big sets as my mum could never afford it so I had smaller sets, at most the mid-range ones.  But one thing I appreciated is that most of the time, the small sets had enough going to keep a child like me going for hours and hours. 

My only contact with Alpha Team was seeing the PC game through a video/demo on a Lego Software CD I got with something in the early 2000s.  I loved the look of the game, and I wanted to play it badly.  I never saw the sets in store and by that time, I’d moved away from Lego bricks to Bionicle. 

As I’ve returned to Lego post my Dark Age, I’ve been buying sets that I might have bought if I hadn’t gotten into Bionicle.  I’m buying the sets I might have bought with more money, with more disposable income and if I’d seen it on shelves here down under.  And now that I have disposable income and a fleeting sense of responsibility, I decided to dive in and check out the Alpha Team with the Ogel Command Striker.

Building Experience

You won’t be doing any sort of complicated building here, no studs on the side, sideways or modular building.  It’s a simple bottom to top build, nothing out of the ordinary.  Whole thing comes together in about two minutes and you’re left with evil villain Ogel and his Command Striker craft.

Ogel looks great.  I love his armor piece and the gold visor, even if the armor is just from the UFO line, and the gold visor from the Space Port helmets.  He looks suitably evil and menacing.

The Command Striker itself looks really nice when finished – the trans-red dish provides a lovely accent, while the greys and reds provide a nice contrast against the mainly black build.

My problem with the build is this:  it’s just not structurally sound.  Humour me for a bit as I try to explain this set through textual explanation.  Maybe go and look at the instructions for this next bit, I’ll wait here.    

So, there’s a light grey 1x6 plate which goes between those two red wedges (let’s call them pontoons).  But the grey plate isn’t attached to the top black wedge plate at all, it’s simply there to attach the two red pontoon pieces and space them apart.  The black wedge which holds the majority of the Command Striker actually sits atop these two 1x 6 black bars, connected to the studs/holes on the bars.  That all then sits on top of the red wedge/pontoon pieces.

What all of this means is that nothing is really holding the model together on the bottom half, or at least making a solid brick to brick connection.  If you press down on the wedge, the black bars bend, the pontoons will bend and then the grey plate pops up and off.  And once that pops off the bars can barely support the top, the whole thing becomes shaky and wobbly and falls apart.  It means you can’t really push down at all on the top piece, limiting the play options.  And it means you basically have to rebuild the entire bottom section if it falls apart.

You would have thought Lego might have thought to stabilise the Command Striker by including some more grey plates or a wedge piece or two – what’s two small pieces in the parts budget of a set?  I had to remedy this structural problem with some smaller light grey plates to connect the grey plate to the black bit to the pontoons.  Once you get a connecting between the top black bit and the grey 1x6 plate, it’s rock solid.

I know I’ve been going on about this but it’s really quite a major flaw, especially with the small size of this model.  The fact it can barely hold itself together is quite a major stumbling block for this little thing.  Not to mention those two pole like laser guns aren’t attached to anything as well, so one wrong touch and they’re coming off. It’s easily remedied by adding some bricks from your own collection.

Parts

Honestly, this set isn’t too crash hot for parts.  You get some red wedge pontoon pieces, the trans-red radar dish which is good.  The black wedge piece is always nice for plane models, robots, spaceships, etc.  A lot of the pieces are just too small, too fiddly and too specialised for use.  The one bit about this set I really like is that you can get the main villain of the Alpha Team line, Ogel, for pretty cheap as I believe the only other set from the 2001 Alpha Team line that Ogel comes in is the Ogel Control Centre

Playability

Once it’s all put together, you’ve got a little riverboat-esque vehicle which you could use to terrorise the rivers and oceans of the world. 

But, of course, that’s just what Lego suggests.  I mean, it doesn’t have to be Ogel driving around on this little Command Striker.  It could be your minifigures taking it for a spin.  Maybe it’s a space vessel and the red pontoons are anti-gravity emitters.  Or maybe it’s a river racer, or some kind of ferry.  But you’re limited to mainly vehicle based ideas with this set as there’s nothing else save Ogel and his craft.

I think this set should have included something else for Ogel to interact with.  Maybe a storage container and some gems, an Ogel skeleton minion, one of the Eye of Ogel orbs from the main Control Centre build or even a bit of terrain.  Something to incite the imagination.  Just having the vehicle means you’re kind of limited to vehicle based play.  I think every set aside from the Ogel Control Centre in the Alpha Team 2001 line was vehicle base, with no landscapes, buildings or base.  It also fits nicely into the Ogel Control Centre if you have that set!

Value for Money

I paid about $15 Australian dollars for this set and I don’t think this set is worth that much at all.  There just aren’t enough pieces or play features to justify this price and for $15 dollars you can get lot better on eBay or Bricklink.

Final Thoughts

I think all up, this is an okay set.  I don’t think it’s very good, but it’s not one of the worst sets around.  It’s below average really.  For what you get, you get a nifty watercraft which, with some improvement, can become even better.  You can get the villain of the Alpha Team lineup without having to go purchase the biggest possible set.  You get a cool looking minifigure and some cool coloured pieces for your own constructions like the trans-red dish

But the fact that the set has poor structure, a lack of overall useful parts and nothing else to interact with means you don’t really have a lot of options with it.  I feel like Ogel really needed something to work with, he needed a weapon or a storage container or even a cheap minion.

If you see it cheap or you want Ogel for your Lego displays, get it, but don’t break your bank for it.
